107216.name: DrawRace 2
107216.description:
DrawRace 2: Racing Evolved, the groundbreaking sequel to the critically acclaimed DrawRace improves on its predecessor in every way. Use the unique, touch-based racing system to blaze through all-new, highly detailed 3D tracks.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107217.name: The Wallachia Castle
107217.description:
From the publisher:

Information has been received on the location of an imprisoned member of the Fellowship. A rescue mission has been mounted and your group will act as logistical support, but will it remain so? (While it is not necessary, heroes planning on pursuing the Knight prestige class are encouraged to play. As a warning, minor spoilers are included for those who have not played modules A103, A106, and A107).

A module designed for any-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 12/14/1905

107218.name: Silent Night
107218.description:
From the publisher:

An Oracle has experienced a mundane crime of robbery. But, the items stolen could have disastrous supernatural consequences. You must solve the crime before the criminals realize what they have and before the local police confiscate the artifacts.

A module designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 12/24/1905.

107219.name: Turf War
107219.description:
From the publisher:

The Javanese have had enough of Dutch rule and are revolting to reclaim their homeland. Will you help maintain civilization, or assist the oppressed natives?

A module designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 12/16/1905.

107220.name: Intrigue at Battle Creek
107220.description:
From the publisher:

When the Fellowship sends you to find information, what favors might you need to do in order to obtain it? What secrets might you be asked to exchange with a patient of the Battle Creek Sanitarium in order to complete your objective?

A module designed for all-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 06/24/1905

107221.name: Lady in Red
107221.description:
From the publisher:

A mysterious dancer who has become popular in Paris recently is somehow involved in a series of unusual events. Your group has been sent to investigate this dancer known as Mata Hari. (It is recommended that characters who speak French play this event).

A module designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of theWhite Star campaign of Earth, 4/14/1905 (low level characters play this module at their own significant risk).

107222.name: RedCat: De Toffe Tijdreis
107222.description:
User Summary

'RedCat: De Toffe Tijdreis' is a Dutch educational game developed and released by Davilex in the second half of the nineties.

Using some kind of time-tavel-ufo RedCat travels through the ages and lands in four periods(Prehistory, Roman ages, Middle ages, Renaissance).

In each period, the player has to collect items and reach the exit of a level to get to the next one. Inbetween some of the levels, the player has to answer multiple choice questions about the period RedCat is currently in.

The game als features a database with historical information about the four periods.

The game is only published in Dutch.

107223.name: Diamonds and Gold
107223.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to San Francisco in pursuit of suspected members of the Diamond Qabal. Where do you begin to find two people in one of the most densely populated cities in the United States? Part One of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an event for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 1/12/1906.

107224.name: Canadian Romance
107224.description:
From the publisher:

Agents of the Order of the Dragon have been identified at Niagra Falls. The Fellowship sends you to discover their plans step by step, inch by inch if possible. Interrogate agents of another qabal without breaking cover in North America’s number one tourist location.

This is an event for low level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 8/6/1906.

107225.name: Panic in the Sky!
107225.description:
From the publisher:

The sky has turned red and the Oracles want to know why. All signs point to a great disaster. Perhaps an important man will die, or a city will be destroyed. The Fellowship sends you to Coney Island to consult with a fortune teller to try and get more information before the tragedy happens.

This is an event for low level heroes in the setting of the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 1/4/1906.

107226.name: Savage Worlds Updates: Chase Rules
107226.description:
From Introduction:

The Vehicle Rules on page 98 handle fast-paced action on the table-top. This is impractical for chases that take place over longer distances such as city streets or the open ocean, so use the Chase rules instead. It’s built for situations when the heroes must catch someone or something—or escape from it!

107227.name: California Burning
107227.description:
From the publisher:

Travel to San Francisco to help Chief Sullivan stop a murderer who uses arson to cover his tracks. The strange thing is all evidence shows that the arsonist burns himself up at the scene of each crime. Part Two of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an event for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 3/7/1906.

107228.name: Panic in the Fire!
107228.description:
From the publisher:

The Oracles send you to Hawaii to consult with the mystics of Pele regarding the red sky. The sky seems to be a warning of tragedy. You need to find out more specifics so that the Fellowship can try and prevent it.

This is an event designed for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 2/16/1906.

107229.name: DrawRace
107229.description:
A totally new and compelling way to race on the iPhone: draw your racing line and speed. Race your way to the top of the global leaderboards!
DrawRace introduces a completely new type of game-and control mechanics, which will keep you hooked time after time. Try to draw the best possible driving path and the optimal speed for the path – and watch how fast you are able to race through the tracks.
Keep improving your times as you find the best way to pass the tracks. In the end, only your skills decide how high you can climb.
In addition to 20 fun and challenging tracks, you can also race against players around the globe in network mode – or if you are playing with your friends, you can immediately see who has the best racing tactics in an exciting hot-seat multiplayer mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

107230.name: Savage Worlds Updates: Damage and Healing
107230.description:
User summary:

Updates to how the Savage Worlds Wounds should be implemented, as well as updated rules for Healing.

107231.name: Save the Arm
107231.description:
From the publisher:

The Presidio in San Francisco is the source of an outbreak of Plague. The Doctors send you to stop the infection from spreading at all costs. Part Three of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an event for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 3/20/1906.

107232.name: Panic in the Water
107232.description:
From the publisher:

Board a ship in San Francisco and help escort fellow members of the Fellowship on a secret mission. It is a simple escort mission that could prevent the end of the world.

This is an event for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 4/1/1906.

107233.name: The Fat Lady's Song
107233.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to attend the Opera in San Francisco. Caruso is performing to a sold out theatre, unless agents of the Six-Fingered Hand get to him first. Part Four of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an Interactive event for all level heroes in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign that occurs on 4/17/1906.

107234.name: Panic in the Ground!
107234.description:
From the publisher:

Entire buildings are being swallowed by sudden sinkholes. An important Fellowship member is trapped in one of them. You have less than four hours to find him and get to the surface safely. Part Five of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an event for low to mid level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 4/18/1906.

107235.name: Savage Worlds Updates: Interludes
107235.description:
From Introduction:

In most heroic tales, characters engage in small talk that reveals something about their past or further develops their personality. Such "Interludes" are rare in roleplaying games where we focus primarily on action and the next encounter.

The system below formulizes these scenes and rewards players for roleplaying their character and revealing their backstory to the rest of the group.

107236.name: Le Paradis Perdu
107236.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to Haiti, the Pearl of the Caribbean, to acquire a mysterious object. But when the heroes meet its owner, they discover that completing the deal will be much more involved than negotiating a price (It is recommended that players who speak French-Creole or French play this adventure).

An event designed for low level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 8/6/1906.

107237.name: An American Werewolf in Bolton
107237.description:
From the publisher:

A werewolf is terrorizing the British countryside. The Fellowship needs for you to track it down and kill it before the next full moon. The fate of a Guardian depends on it.

An event designed for low level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 1/18/1906.

107238.name: Give me Liberty AND Give me Death
107238.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to investigate the death of a writer in a small town in Wisconsin, USA. Is it a case of life imitating art or art imitating life? Heroes with the Psychology feat are encouraged to participate in this event.

This event is designed for low level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 7/18/1906.

107239.name: Death, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness
107239.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship returns to Liberty, Wisconsin, this time to investigate a macabre event on a dairy farm. Can the characters uncover secrets festering under the surface of this small town before it is too late? Part 2 in the Liberty series. (It is recommended that players participate in Give Me Liberty and Give Me Death before playing this adventure.)

This is an adventure designed for low- and mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 9/24/1906.

107240.name: Dream Track Nation
107240.description:
Who needs boring old reality?

In Dream Track Nation let your imagination run wild as you race to the finish in some of the craziest, most colorful and downright silly racetracks you’ve ever seen! Collect stars, use power-ups and jump huge gaps in this unique take on arcade racing. Use the incredible inbuilt track editor to create any track you desire, and then race it against your friends online! Dream Track Nation allows you to pair up with anyone in the world and see who’s got what it takes to bring home the gold!

Source: The Publisher Website.

107241.name: Libertistrata
107241.description:
From the publisher:

The characters are summoned to Liberty, Wisconsin, to look into the disappearance of a Fellowship agent. But why is everyone in town acting so strange? Will the investigators be able to solve the mystery rather than getting caught up in it? Part 3 in the Liberty series. (It is recommended that players participate in the first two parts before playing this adventure, B203 and B208).

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, April 20, 1907

107243.name: Liberty Belle
107243.description:
From the publisher:

The characters return to Liberty, Wisconsin, for the town's annual Cheese Festival. With a full slate of activities and a large influx of out-of-towners, can the celebration go off without a hitch? Part 4 in the Liberty series. (It is recommended that players participate in the first three parts before playing this adventure; B203, B208 and B304.)

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, August 1, 1907.

107244.name: Automatic
107244.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to the mountains of West Virginia to investigate the supernatural claims of a sickly girl. But will you be the only ones interested in her abilities? (It is recommended that characters with the Sixth Sense feat play this adventure.)

This is an event for low-level heroes in the setting of the Fellowship of the White Star, Earth 8/15/1906.

107245.name: Mystery P.I.: The Lottery Ticket
107245.description:
Mystery P.I.: The Lottery Ticket is a hidden object game, created and published by SpinTop Games. The title is now published by PopCap Games. The object of the game is to find a lottery ticket belonging to the player character's grandmother. When it's found, the player character is rewarded with over 400 million dollars in prize money. Before that, the player must find various hidden objects and solve various clues which all relate to the lottery ticket.

Source: Wikipedia, "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mystery_P.I. Mystery P.I.]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107246.name: Nature of the Beast
107246.description:
From the publisher:

A Gatherer sent to investigate rumors of “large wolves” attacking loggers in the forests near Harrison Mills in the Canadian Rockies has disappeared. Your party is asked to travel to Harrison Mills and locate the missing Gatherer.

This is an event for low level heroes in the setting of the Fellowship of the White Star, Earth 3/10/1906.

107247.name: Etolis: Arena
107247.description:
Can you survive the Arena?

Captured by an invading alien horde, you were thrown into the Arena as a galactic gladiator, forced to fight for their entertainment. No one has survived beyond the first round, but they have underestimated you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107248.name: Manual Labor
107248.description:
From the publisher:

Wow are you dirty after that mission in the sewers. A hot bath and a change of clothes would sure feel good just about now. So why is this debriefing taking so long? A mid level adventure set in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign on Wednesday 6/13/1906. Heroes under level 6 are severely discouraged from playing this event.

This adventure is recommended for heroes who have already played B102 Thunderbirds!, B105 The Rock and/or B206 Automatic, but it isn’t required.

107249.name: The Greatest Gift of All
107249.description:
From the publisher:

When a Fellowship Hunter dies in a hospital under mysterious circumstances is it coincidence, or a new plot by one of the White Star’s enemies?

A holiday event for low level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 12/31/1906.

107250.name: Island Estate
107250.description:
From the publisher:

The Oracles have found the hidden base of the Six-Fingered Hand on an isolated island in the Pacific Ocean. They arm you with six powerful amulets and send you to stop their plan to destroy the world. This is a combat heavy event for mid to high level heroes that occurs on 4/15/1906.

Warning that this module may be more suited to combat and sneaky characters. D201 will Available now! The exciting conclusion to the amulet series!

107251.name: City of the Dead
107251.description:
From the publisher:

The Irish, Scottish and Chinese cultures clash in a violent battle for property in the city of San Francisco. But, there is a fourth minority who wants a segment of town for their own. The Undead. Part Six of the Faulty Towers series.

This is an event for all level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, May of 1906.

107252.name: Juno First
107252.description:
from the back of the box

As you await flight control clearance for departure, you wonder if the pioneers of space exploration felt the same icy chill, awaiting lift-off of their crude 20th century space shuttle missions.

Fully briefed on the mysterious waves of alien encounters in a dimension uncharted by human life forms, you alone must defend the solar system for the good of mankind. Suddenly, the reality of the mission sparks a rush of energy through your body. At every turn you encounter deadly alien spacecraft. With the fireworks of explosions encircling you, you blast the aliens with your laser beams. In a last effort to escape certain death, you quickly grasp the joystick and firmly place one hand over the warp trigger.

Instantly you are hurled through a kaleidoscope of color for a moment that seems to last an eternity, a moment that is exciting beyond belief, a moment that is...JUNO FIRST!

FEATURES:
-spectacular graphics and sound
-laser beam and warp controls
-one or two players

107253.name: A Museum for the Common Folk
107253.description:
From the publisher:

You have a job to do at the old McKittrick mansion. Now what is all this hogwash about the place being haunted? This is a 1906 intro module is playable with the pre-gens provided or with first level characters with no experience.

Set in San Francisco on 3/2/1906.

107254.name: Grand Prix Manager
107254.description:
Grand Prix Manager (GPM) is a Formula 1 management game released in December 1995 by MicroProse. It featured the 1995 Formula 1 season. The game consists of Long Term and Short Term challenges. Long Term games were made up of 40 seasons of F1 (in game from 1995-2035) while Short Term challenges dictated a specific outcome to be met over 1,2 or 3 seasons. Failure to fulfill the challenges resulted in being fired and losing the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grand Prix Manager", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107255.description:
In Evo, you play a nomadic people in symbiosis with a primitive reptilian species. You travel the wild open spaces of Kumgath with your mounts, you will use your knowledge of biology to help them adapt and succeed against both the hostile and changing climate and other competing species.

Players will earn mutation points during the course of the game. The player with the most at the end of the game is the winner.

Changes in this edition:

Initiative is based on bidding position for the mutation/adaptation genes, and tails have been done away.
Climate change is based on a token draw instead of a die roll.
The combat die is no longer a regular D6 but has symbols which serves approximately the same odds as before.
There is a 1-in-6 chance for a stalemate otherwise, depending on the difference in horns, the defender will have a dinosaur removed from the board
The attackers dinosaur can never die.

Evolution occurs after climate change instead of later in the turn.
There are 12 climate tokens, delineating strictly 9 to 11 turns, with the game-ending meteor event occurring in one of the last three climate tokens.
Players only have a maximum 8 dinosaurs, while the older game had a maximum of 10.
There are 12 new "special" genes, 8 of which are mixed in with the regular genes.
Each have a unique power/ability such as flying, amphibious movement, chameleon capability for defense, or the ability to predict the future climate.

One event card is available each turn during bidding with the number of players minus one genes pulled out of the bag.
Winning the event card will give the player first initiative and is only modified by number of dinosaurs on the board.
107255.name: Evo (second edition)

107256.name: Pain in the Heart
107256.description:
From the publisher:

It has been a troubling time for the Midwest, with a rampant blight that claimed much of last year’s harvest and a current drought which grows more severe every day. Now, word comes of a strange illness sweeping thru one small Iowa town. Could this be the final nail in the coffin of America's Bread Basket? The Fellowship wants you to discover what's stalking field and farmer alike and avert a worldwide famine at the same time.

This is an FWS event for low level heroes set on May 23, 1907.

107257.name: The Great Train Robbery?
107257.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship has a unique opportunity in Sweden. Gather your forces and practice your subterfuge as you need to physically acquire and smuggle a powerful artifact safely out of the country.

This is an FWS tactical combat oriented event for mid level heroes set on March 16, 1907.

107258.name: The Richest Hill on Earth
107258.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship is sent to unearth a qabalistic plot in the rough-and-tumble mining city of Butte, Montana. But will they be able to discern sinister happenings from the day-to-day conflicts of a mining town?

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, Tuesday, June 11, 1907.

107259.name: Dragsholm Castle
107259.description:
From the publisher:

The heroes travel to Dragsholm Castle in Denmark to keep a powerful creature from joining the side of evil.

This is an FWS event for mid level heroes set on May 15, 1907.

107260.name: Below the Belt
107260.description:
From the publisher:

Is someone simply taking advantage of the orchestrations affecting America earlier in the year, or is he the mastermind who ordered it?

An FWS event for low level characters occurring in October 11, 1907.

107261.name: Death of a Statesman
107261.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship has reason to believe that Manuel Barrios, President of the Peruvian Senate, is targeted for assassination during his visit to Paris. However, there is also reason to believe that Barrios associates with the Six-Fingered Hand. Before determining if you can save him, you need to decide if you should.

An event for mid level heroes set on October 9, 1907. Recommended for any heroes who have favorable notice by the Illumines I (available in the event B108: Lady In Red.)

107262.name: The Tundra
107262.description:
From the publisher:

Back to Russia? Rasputin must be up to something.

A Mid level module set in the FWS campaign setting, Russia Wednesday, April 10, 1907. Part 4 of The White Realms series.

Warning, this module is unusual for the campaign; it does not focus primarily on investigation and may be more appropriate and survivable with at least some combat characters in the party. Tinkerers and characters pursuing the Mad Scientist prestige class are also encouraged to play.

107263.name: Grand Prix Manager 2
107263.description:
Grand Prix Manager 2 is a 1996 Formula 1 management simulation for Windows systems and is based on its prequel, Grand Prix Manager. It was developed by Edward Grabowski Communications Ltd and published by Microprose, and it is licensed by FIA to have real statistics for the 1996 Formula One season. A sequel, Grand Prix World, was released in 2000.

The game is composed of long and short term "contracts", long term games being made up of 10 seasons of F1 (in game from 1996–2005) whilst short term challenges dictated a specific outcome to be met over 1, 2 or 3 seasons, failure of these resulting in being fired and losing the game.[2] In long term challenges, the only way to lose the game is that the player's team goes bankrupt. The game can be played on the same computer with one to four players in a hotseat mode, assigning turns for the players to make their decisions. Before the start of a long term scenario, the player(s) may freely edit the teams and personnel to their liking by using a simple in-game editor. Short term scenarios cannot be modified.

During the game the player(s) must hire & dismiss personnel, negotiate with sponsors to secure the team's finances, control the research of new parts to stay competitive, negotiate contracts with engine, fuel, and spare parts suppliers, control testing and set up the car according to hints given by the drivers.
The race screen

Before a race weekend the player(s) can choose whether he/she wants to see the different sessions or just skip them, thus allowing the game to simulate the results. The car setup can also be altered during these sessions. Before the race the fuel & tyre strategy of both cars has to be set, the game giving a suggestion to the player(s) which can be freely modified.Stirling Moss provides commentary during the race. After the race certain news stories based on the race's results and current game events are displayed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grand Prix Manager 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107264.name: Busman's Holiday
107264.description:
From the publisher:

In gratitude for your tireless service, the Fellowship sends you on a cruise so you can regain your equilibrium. But will your curiosity get in the way of true relaxation?

This is an FWS event for mid level heroes set on Tuesday, March 6, 1907.

107265.name: Ewe Doodle: Keep the Sheep Alive
107265.description:
Keep the sheep from being made into mutton in this dark-humored, high score game that will test the your dexterity and quick thinking. Keep the little lamb alive as long as you can, the more time you manage, the higher your score! But there's a catch, the longer you last, the harder it gets!

Source: The Publisher Website.

107266.name: The Agrarian Way
107266.description:
From the publisher:

Travel to Iowa to look into a local "agrarian problem."

A low level adventure set in the FWS campaign, July 12, 1907.

107267.name: The Unwrapping
107267.description:
From the publisher:

The British museum is unwrapping a newly procured mummy from the Valley of the Kings. The Fellowship has confirmed that the mummy is supernatural, but has been unable to stop the unwrapping. You are tasked with being there to prevent the inevitable problems. Can you do so without making the public panic?

An interactive event for all level heroes set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1907.

107268.name: Red Crown
107268.description:
From the publisher:

"Beware the Red Crown," the old woman divined. "The Crown corrupts. Fire burns and cauldron bubbles. Ah, the years do slip away...." Why are divinations always so cryptic? Will blind trust reveal all or be but the first step on the road to perdition?

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, Monday, August 5, 1907.

107269.name: Radio City Monroe Hall
107269.description:
From the publisher:

Nikoli Tesla is selling industrial secrets in order to keep his research facility, Wardenclyffe Tower, active. But, someone (or something) is killing his scientists. The police think that these are fatal accidents, but Tesla thinks that Edison is sabotaging his work.

An event for Mid level characters in July, 1907.

107270.name: Happy Birthday!
107270.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship calls on your help to investigate an antebellum plantation in the outskirts of Atlanta. An old man rambles about an evil at the home, but is he just rambling in his old age or is their truth in his fears.

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, Wednesday, October 30, 1907.

107271.name: Away in a Manger
107271.description:
From the publisher:

Unconnected disappearances in a small Appalachian town raise alarm among the Gatherers. Can you find the missing people in time to share Christmas with their friends and family?

An event for characters of low to mid level set in Dec 24, 1907.

107272.name: Rivals
107272.description:
From the publisher:

Charles Kennedy is back and has plans for San Francisco again. But things may not be as they first appear. What lurks in the dark recesses of the mind of evil? (epilogue to the 1906 Faulty Towers series).

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, Friday, April 19, 1907.

107273.name: The Attache's Tale
107273.description:
From the publisher:

The heroes travel to the International Peace Conference in The Hague to investigate the death of a Fellowship operative. If the 'how' doesn't stump them, there's always the 'when', the 'where', and the 'why'. This tongue-in-cheek module can be played in just a couple of hours.

This is an FWS event for low-level characters set in The Netherlands, August 16, 1907.

107274.name: Standards of Living
107274.description:
From the publisher:

What connects American labor disputes, global food shortages, and European politics? The Fellowship advises you to avoid the notice of the man named Richthofen while you find out.

107275.name: Rook
107275.description:
From the publisher:

Lord Reginald St. Charles always has enjoyable parties, but this isn’t just your standard dinner party.

An event designed to introduce players and new characters to the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, March 23, 1907.

107276.name: London Calling
107276.description:
From the publisher:

One of our Gatherers is also a name at Lloyds’s of London who reports that some of his recent investments may involve the business of the supernatural rather than of insurance. Go to London to see if you can help.

An FWS event for low level characters occurring on Friday, April 3, 1908.

107277.name: London Answering
107277.description:
From the publisher:

A mystic in London assaults a constable in order to get himself (or herself) arrested. He is worried that the violent visions he is experiencing may either predict harm coming to himself or may drive him to hurt others. A member in Scottland Yard alerts the Fellowship that this is a person who needs to be spoken to.

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107278.name: Unlikely Ally
107278.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship sends you to Africa to try and find the infamous Jack the Ripper. He is "needed" to put the spirits in Whitechapel to rest.

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107279.name: Unwilling Ally
107279.description:
From the publisher:

Can the heroes really get Jack the Ripper to help the side of good, however unwilling he is? Or will the spirits in Whitechapel never rest?

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908. Premier for Origins 2011

107280.name: The Fogs of London
107280.description:
From the publisher:

Sightings of ghosts in Whitechapel cause the Fellowship to send you to the east end of London to investigate.

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908. Premier for Origins 2011

107281.name: It Never Rains
107281.description:
From the publisher:

Slayings in Singapore attract the attention of the Fellowship Oracles. There is something familiar about the manner in which many prostitutes are meeting a violent death.

An adventure designed for mid/high-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107282.name: The Ghosts of London
107282.description:
From the publisher:

Starting on August 31, a ghost on Durward Street appears every day at 3:40 AM and remains until it has tasted blood. Another starts appearing on Hanbury Street on September 8. Can you put them to rest before the body count reaches a point that the supernatural aspect of the killings can no longer be ignored?

An adventure designed for mid/high-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107283.name: The Tunguska Event
107283.description:
From the publisher:

The elders in Pokrovskoye, Russia have uncovered a plot that Rasputin is about to unleash on not only Russia, but the world. Can the heroes thwart his nefarious mind once again?

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107284.name: Grand Prix Manager
107284.description:
Grand Prix Manager places the player in the role of the manager of a Formula 1 racing team, with the ultimate goal being to reach to highest management rating. This can only be achieved by winning the championship on the hardest difficulty setting.

The player can choose how many races to take part in over the course of a season, and after each race the player is presented with a race performance screen, followed by car upgrade options. Revenue is generated through sponsorship, however sponsors will base their investment on their satisfaction with previous race results. This income is used to hire mechanics and a driver from a set list of well known Formula 1 drivers.

The player makes choices from menu screens regarding aspects of the car such as the tires, depth of tire tread and angle of the rear wing, and is then shown highlights of the race.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grand Prix Manager (1984 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107285.name: The Streets of London
107285.description:
From the publisher:

1908 is the twentieth anniversary of the notorious Jack the Ripper murders in East London. The streets are once again flowing with blood. Can you and your fellow agents find a clue as to who the copycat murderer is?

107286.name: Family Values
107286.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship has been alerted that something strange is happening concerning the Orphan Asylum in Knightsbridge, England. Can the children be saved?

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107287.name: Enlighten Me
107287.description:
From the publisher:

A member of the Fellowship is arrested for murder in Paris, and the characters are sent to investigate the circumstances. Is the case as open-and-shut as it appears, or is there more going on than meets the eye?

An adventure designed for low-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107288.name: Island of Dr. Monroe
107288.description:
From the publisher:

The Fellowship is investigating the history of Dr Terry Monroe. They ask you to travel to an unknown location, and are unsure what you will find there. This is a challenge for people who can think on their feet, and quickly assess the unprecedented.

An adventure designed for mid-level characters set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, August 25, 1907.

107289.name: To the Sun
107289.description:
From the publisher:

The Six-Fingered Hand has summoned Atum, the God-Eater to kill the sun god Ra. The Fellowship had to ally with deadly enemies in order to combat this threat to all life. The magic of Imhotep has taken you to Ra's home, and the strength of Dracula is by your side. Your battle against Atum will determine the fate of all life on Earth.

An event for all level heroes who have the "To The Sun" certificate from "Island Estate" set in the Fellowship of the White Star setting of Earth, 1908.

107290.name: While in Chicago
107290.description:
From the publisher:

An event designed to introduce players and new characters to the FWS campaign in 1908. The pre-gen characters that are provided at the end of the module fit the module the best. If they are not used, players will need to supply their own role-play reason for their 1st level hero being at the event.

107291.name: Professor Gordian's Grimoire
107291.description:
From the back of the book:

Professor Gordian's Grimoire contains 148 pages of monsters described and statted as found in the Fellowship of the White Star campaign including dozens of new monsters. There is a plethora of phenominal artworks including over 20 from the supremely talented artist Jesse Cutler, who did the awesome dragon on the front cover.

107292.name: Grand Prix World
107292.description:
Grand Prix World is the sequel to Grand Prix Manager 2 and is based around the 1998 Formula One season (officially FIA licensed).

The player takes control of one of the 11 F1 teams participating in the 1998 Formula One season. Team names or details could not be changed within the game itself. This was only able to be done using a 3rd party editor.

Grand Prix World is very different to the preceding games, even though they largely share the same code base, the major changes coming in the interface design and negotiation modules with sponsors, drivers, engineers. This results in less 'freak' results such as player being able to sign top line drivers for the bottom ranking teams, or being able to score points with said teams without major re-organisation of the team.

Source: Wikipedia, "Grand Prix World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107293.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Whenin this volume are the various Harpoon data annexes, containing new data pertinent to the Pacific Rim countries covered in the background & scenario booklet. Annexes C-M provide statistics for weapons and sensors not listed in Harpoon, as well as some systems added to the system since the original rules set was published, and some errata.
107293.name: Sea of Dragons: Data Annexes Ships, Aircraft, & Weapons

107294.name: Penguins!
107294.description:
User Summary

A Lemmings-style puzzle game, featuring penguins. Inspired by the documentary 'The March of the Penguins' (La marche de l'empereur) by Luc Jacquet.

107295.name: Mystery P.I.: The Vegas Heist
107295.description:
The heist of the century has just happened in Vegas! Over $4 Billion in cash has been stolen from the state's newest casino the day before its grand opening. The casino has hired you to find & return the money before the doors open the next day. Your fee will be $50 Million if you succeed. Hurry - you only have 15 hours to return the money back to the casino!

Investigate 25 intriguing Vegas locations to find over 2300 cleverly hidden objects. As your investigation skills improve your P.I. rank increases. Strive for a "Perfect Investigation" every time to earn bonus points.

Two addictive ways to play: In Vegas Heist mode you must find clues and piece the clues together to discover the location of the money and return it before the casino's grand opening. Unlock Unlimited Seek & Find game mode to search for every hidden object in every scene with no time limits. Collect all the hidden Keys & Poker Chips to unlock Unlimited Seek & Find mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

107296.name: Nightlong: Union City Conspiracy
107296.description:
It's the year 2099, and the player assume the role of the top-notch investigator named Joshua Reev. His long-time friend, Hugh Martens, summons him to help him with a matter of major political importance. It seems that a group of terrorists is tearing the city to shreds, and Martens has called on Reev to put an end to the madness.

Nightlong is predominantly an inventory management type of game, with a few puzzles thrown in. The game has backgrounds that appear to be a mixture of texture-mapped and hand-drawn graphics. The game is played mostly from the third-person perspective, and game characters are cyberpuppets. Background music and sound effects are unobtrusive. The navigation interface uses left-click to examine an object, right-click to use, interact with or combine objects in the game or in inventory. Hotspots are indicated with on-screen text. Many of the game's plot elements rely on finding a single object. For this amount of pixel hunting, a large-screen monitor is recommended. An inventory bar is accessible at the bottom of the screen, and the Escape key is used for the game control menu. The Escape key can also be used to skip video and dialog sequences, and right-clicking on screen exits avoids waiting for character walking. Useful "Go to..." text indicates previously-unexplored exits. A handy instant-navigation feature is also available for part of the game.

The game is actually somewhat non-linear since some tasks can be solved in a different order, with the gameplay periodically simplified by one-way plot elements. There are only twelve saved-game slots, which may be too few for some players. However, multiple sets of saved games can be retained by manually copying SAVEGAME.* files from the game installation directory. An audible indication of the main character's shrug is needed so you have a better idea when nothing can be done with an inventory item or hotspot. There are few inventory red herrings since most of the stuff gets used at some point or other. Strong language appears at a few points in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nightlong: Union City Conspiracy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107297.name: Mystery P.I.: The New York Fortune
107297.description:
A fun loving & eccentric New York billionaire has hidden the will to his vast fortune somewhere in New York City! His family only has 17 hours to locate the will or their Grandpa's entire estate will be given to his cat & dog.

You are the world famous Mystery P.I. and the family has hired you to track down the clues hidden all over NYC. Seek & Find over 2100 hidden objects in 25 amazing NY locations like Times Square, Central Park, Coney Island, the Brooklyn Bridge and many more. If you succeed you will be awarded $25 Million dollars.

Three addictive ways to play: In NY Fortune mode you must find the clues to locate the will. Collect all the Keys & Apples to unlock two Unlimited game modes: Unlock Unlimited Seek & Find and Spot the Differences to find every hidden item in every scene.

Source: The Developer Website.

107298.name: Cavelon
107298.description:
User Summary

Princess Guinevere has been imprisoned in the maze of sinister castle Blah! So you embark on the arduous quest of her deliverance. Armed with the legendary Excalibur, your arrows and unswerving gallantry, you must ascend to the sixth floor of the castle where the princess is held, and free her of her tribulation. Your trek is perilous, so you must demonstrate prudence. A host of pestilent enemy archers and knights will try to deflate your ardor, so gird yourself for serious battle.

107299.name: Ball der Prinzessin
107299.description: The game board is a ballroom in which six princesses are waiting to be chosen by the prince. The active player rolls a color die and places the prince in front of one of the princesses and asks her to dance. The princess is put onto a mirror in the middle of the game board, then slowly turned so her wide dress lifts a bid and reveals the color of the other clothes hidden beneath. If it matches the die result, the player receives a crown; if not, the princess is placed on a currently empty field (not the one she came from) and a candle tile is turned around. When all candles are turned around, the player with most crowns is the winner.

107300.name: The President is Missing
107300.description:
The President Is Missing came on a video game cassette but also had an audio cassette with different recordings and an anonymous note signed by "Saduj" (Judas in reverse).

In the video game itself, which is set in 1996, the President of the United States is attending an anti-terror summit in Europe with ten Western European leaders. Terrorists attack the summit, knocking out the attendees and security personnel with sleeping gas. The terrorists then kidnap the president and the other leaders and hold them hostage. The terrorists leave an audiotape behind, stating that they are Islamic and make numerous demands in exchange for safe release of the hostages.

The player assumes the role of the special investigator, who must find the President and the rest of the hostages. The investigator works from his computer terminal, which has access to dossiers of many different individuals such as known terrorists and members of the Cabinet. The investigator also has eight special agents, whom he can send out to interview people or find out information. The agents' reports are then stored on the computer.

The audiotape that comes with the game contains news reports, recorded messages by the President of the United States and the President of France while in captivity, intercepted telephone calls, an interview with the First Lady, and intercepts of Morse code messages.

The game includes tools to decipher Morse code messages and other coded clues.

If the player learned where a hostage or hostages were being held, he could send a special strike team to a particular address. The strike team would then report its findings, which could include other clues.

The computer terminal also has two secret files, one by the CIA and one by the National Security Council, that could not be accessed without prior authorization. The player, however, could attempt to hack into the files.

As the game went on, it was clear that there was a much wider conspiracy going on. The player had to figure it out. As a game, the President is Missing never ended. The game includes a note telling the player that once he unraveled the game's complex plot, he was to write a report and summarize all of the evidence and send it to Cosmi. In turn, the company would respond to the player.

Source: Wikipedia, "The President is Missing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107301.name: Mystery P.I.: Lost in Los Angeles
107301.description:
Mystery P.I. - Lost in Los Angeles

The only copy of this year's biggest blockbuster movie has gone missing the day before the VIP Hollywood premiere. You are the world famous Mystery P.I. and have been hired to track down and return the lost movie.

Seek & Find over 2100 hidden objects in 25 stunning L.A. locations like Malibu Beach, Rodeo Drive, Movie Sets, Hollywood hot spots and many more. Hurry you only have 17 hours to locate the movie or the Hollywood Studio will be ruined. If you succeed you will be awarded $15 Million dollars.

3 addictive ways to play: Solve the L.A. Mystery to track down the lost blockbuster movie. Collect all the special Keys & Film Reels to unlock two Unlimited game modes: Unlimited Seek & Find and a Match 3 Puzzle Game.

Source: The Developer Website.

107302.name: Mystery P.I: The London Caper
107302.description:
The priceless Crown Jewels have been stolen and the thieves have given the Royal Family only 17 hours to pay a sizeable ransom, or the jewels will be destroyed. You are the world famous Mystery P.I. and have been hired by the Royal Family to find these irreplaceable artifacts before the ransom is paid.
Seek & Find over 2000 hidden objects in 25 intruiging London, England locations. Hurry, you only have 17 hours to recover the Crown Jewels! If you succeed you will be awarded £10 Million Pounds.

Three fun ways to play including two bonus game modes. Collect all the hidden Keys & Crowns to unlock two Unlimited Bonus Game modes. As your investigation skills improve your P.I. rank increases. Strive for a "Perfect Investigation" every time to earn bonus points.

Source: The Developer Website.

107303.name: Mystery P.I.: Stolen in San Francisco
107303.description:
$250 Million in solid gold has been stolen from an armored car. The gold's owner has hired you to find & return the gold before the trail goes cold and it is lost forever. Seek & Find over 2100 hidden objects in 25 amazing San Francisco locations to track down the stolen gold!

You are the world famous Mystery P.I. and you must find the clues hidden all over the Golden Gate city. Seek & Find over 2100 hidden objects in 25 amazing locations like the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Haight-Ashbury, Fisherman's Wharf and many more. If you succeed you will be awarded $20 Million dollars.

Three addictive ways to play: In 'Find the Stolen Gold' mode you must find clues that will lead you to the gold. Collect all the Keys & Peace Symbols to unlock two Unlimited game modes: Unlock Unlimited Seek & Find and a Match-3 Bonus game. Go for a 'Perfect Investigation' and speed bonuses to maximize your points to become a Master P.I.!

Source: The Developer Website.

107304.name: SpaceKids
107304.description:
SpaceKids is a children's entertainment/educational game. In this interactive cartoon, two Kids, Zeedle and Deet, have gone from the moon to Earth to look for their lost Grandpa; Grandpa is a famous space explorer, and the Kids are taking their saucer to go find him.

Source: Wikipedia, "SpaceKids", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107305.name: Starlord
107305.description:
Starlord is a science-fiction strategy game published by Microprose in 1993. It was designed by Mike Singleton in a similar vein to his previous titles Midwinter and Lords of Midnight.

French band Galderia released an album on their website based on the story of this game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Starlord (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107306.name: TrackMania Sunrise
107306.description:
The second game in the series, TrackMania Sunrise, features more realistic graphics and contains three environments: Island, Bay, and Coast. As in the original game, each has a unique car to fit the environment's characteristics. "Island" features fast sports cars which can turn sharply on mostly wide roads while "Bay" has bouncy cars with less traction, making accidental oversteering more likely. "Coast" features slower cars with little traction and small roads where cars are able to drift through corners. The game was built on an overhauled engine for better visuals and Internet connectivity with tracks that include skinnable advertisement panels. This version also features two new gameplay modes: Platform gives players a start and finish point with mandatory checkpoints and restart points in between while Crazy returns to the race course, but this time pits the player against ghosts, each of which has a faster time than the last.
Some of TrackMania Sunrise other enhancements were later added to the Original edition of the game. These include the ability to import new car models and customize many more aspects of the game. "Sunrise" features improved Internet connectivity and implements a peer-to-peer system allowing players to share car models, skins, and more. The new track editor primarily uses the mouse as opposed to the keyboard-driven original, and makes possible special effects like displaying text and changing the camera angle using Media Tracker.

Source: Wikipedia, "TrackMania", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107307.name: Out of Order
107307.description:
User Summary

It was just another ordinary night in the life of Hurford Schlitzting... until his room, and himself inside it, was hijacked by an alien ship! Now Hurford has to figure out why they want him and just what is going on in this bizarre alien world.

With Out of Order, Hungry Software has used their free-to-use SLUDGE system to create an adventure game in the style of well-known classics like Monkey Island and Full Throttle. Combining a stylized sci-fi environment with a goofy sense of humor, Out of Order presents a challenging and interesting game that should please any fan of old-school adventure games.

107308.name: Armour-Geddon
107308.description:
From the back of the box:

Post-Holocaust: A power crazed entity desires control of earth. They develop an energy beam and intend to bounce it off a custom-built satellite back to earth. All unprotected life will be wiped out.

You select and control up to six diverse hi-tech vehicles at once in a race against time to seek and destroy enemy power lines and eventually knock out their beam generator.

Build up your arsenal by collecting enemy resources to help develop and create your own new weapon systems.

Featuring a sophisticated head-to-head serial link enabling 'being-there' realism between two players.

Armour-Geddon: Strategy and simulation synthesized to perfection.

User Summary

The two-player mode was through the use of a null-modem cable which could be used to connect two Amigas, two Atari STs or even one Amiga and one Atari ST.

107309.name: Coffeetime Crosswords
107309.description:
User Summary

This is a bare-bones digital version of a crossword puzzle game. Once a blank square is selected, a rotary wheel filled with letters appears. The player rotates the wheel until the sought-after letter appears, which can then be selected. There are no customization options.

There is single-player and co-op network multi-player. The 150 different puzzles were developed by Penny Press.

This game is no longer available to download on XBLA.

107310.name: Cake Mania: In the Mix!
107310.description:
After standing up to Mega Mart and rescuing her grandparents' bakery from near elimination, our heroine, Jill Evans, is looking toward the future and dreaming of bringing her cakes to the world. Following the hectic, time-management style gameplay of the original Cake Mania, and the branching storyline of Cake Mania 2, Cake Mania: In the Mix! introduces all-new characters, custom cake decorating and a unique co-op mode where Jill can get some much needed assistance.

Features

- Brand-new Wii experience, based on Sandlot Games award-winning online PC hit franchise Cake Mania, that has been downloaded more than 100 million times and sold 650,000 units worldwide on the DS!

- Use your Wii Remote to manage all aspects of the bakery from selecting cake types and baking, to frosting and decorating your creations-in the series' hallmark resource management game play style.

- Customize Jill's bakeries with 50 unique kitchen upgrades: Ovens, Shoes, Frosters, Display Stands, Cookie Ovens, TVs, Toppers and Frosterators. A Fish Tank, Tables and Benches are new to the Wii version!

- Create your very own unique Custom Cakes. Select up to a 3 tier Cake, add frosting and choose from 19 different decorations.

- 9 all-new fantastic locations to experience: High Rise Bakery, Underwater Bakery, South Pole Bakery, Iron Baker Studio, Top Secret Bakery on the Moon, Future Bakery, New Evan's Bakery, Tropical Island Bakery and Rainforest Bakery.

- All-new demanding and special customers range from ninjas to pregnant moms to leprechauns!

- Send Digital Greeting Cards of your cake creations to friends online using WiiConnect24.

- Co-operative play allows up to 4 players to play at once.See how you measure up in Endless Baking mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107311.name: MLB Stickball
107311.description:
User Summary

This baseball game transports major league players into the neighborhoods of US cities. The game's presentation is very playful with all of the player's sporting "big heads". Gamers can only control the batter or the pitcher. You time the swing with a meter. You pitch by choosing one of the 4 pitches that are tied to the controller's face buttons. The gamer cannot control the AI fielders. Each of the neighborhoods has its own set of rules that determines how points are scored.

There are 120 MLB players that can be unlocked by spending points in the in-game store to buy packs of baseball cards. These packs unlock new players.

107312.name: Armour-Geddon II: Codename Hellfire
107312.description:
From the back of the box:

2083 AD... The world is a barren shell, ravaged by the fallout form the Resource Wars which raged at the end of the 20th Century.

The survivors have divided into two groups: the pus-filled mutants who dwell on the surface and the privileged elite who had fallout shelters and have since stayed underground.

When an ancient satellite with awesome destructive powers is discovered, the embers of emnity suddenly burst into flames ... Codename Hellfire is a stunning future war sim which puts the fate of the entire human race into your sweaty palms.

Features include:


Real time player control of up to six vehicles simultaneously, allowing execution of joint combat sorties
One or two player competitive play
Over 15,000 physical objects on the map which extends over a relative area of 112,589 km2 [sic]


We tried and failed to the the world once.

Now the human race has something it really doesn't need - a second chance...

107313.name: Call for Heroes: Pompolic Wars
107313.description:
A State of Chaos
Years ago a dimensional portal to the Outer Worlds was suddenly opened, and an enemy from the darkness encroached on our world. Led by a demon named Pompolic, armies of demonic hordes quickly overran most of the planet. The origin of Pompolic remains unknown, but it is certain that this malevolent spiritual being possesses supernatural powers. His desire is obvious: possess the people and turn them into minions of his dark army. He wields his power through his servants, the Dark Souls. The Dark Souls, protected by horde of monsters, infiltrate people's minds and make them slaves of evil. The denizens of our world are on the edge of total annihilation.
A Call for Heroes
However, a faint hope still exists in the heart of the surviving citizens. They believe that there are brave hearts who can save the world from the source of evil. If the Dark Souls could be captured, Pompolic could be stopped and perhaps even defeated. To realize their hope, the citizens call for a hero.
The Journey
The times when a traveler could pass through the lands without fear are gone. Now at every step there are hordes of monsters with one purpose: to protect the Dark Souls by slaying anyone who is not a follower of darkness. But a great warrior with strong will, faith, and mighty weapons may succeed in defeating them. By building his or her strength, armor, and health, by harvesting the souls of monsters to gain incredible abilities, a hero may grow strong enough to challenge the Dark Souls. Will that hero be you?
Game Features
This is a third-person hack & slash style action game with RPG elements placed in a fantasy world for the PC and Nintendo Wii. The game is divided into 15 maps that range from mysterious environments to the grass strewn plains and dark dungeons. The player can choose between 2 characters, each with unique weapons and special abilities. Whichever character is chosen, there will be constant action with hordes of monsters. There are 18 types of monsters, and at the end of the game the boss awaits the player.

The game uses the latest lighting and shadowing techniques, including real-time shadows, DOT3 bump mapping, water reflections, particle systems and more. Monsters also have advanced bump-mapping and lighting models including specular lighting.

Source: The Game Website.

107314.name: Crazy Mouse
107314.description:
User Summary

This game plays similar to Pac-Man. The player controls a mouse that is trying to move through a maze and eat-up food. There are 32 levels in the story mode. Most levels involve directing your mouse to get to the food before the opponent mice do. There is multi-player for up to four players at one time (either local or network).

107315.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare – Reflex Edition
107315.description:
Modern Warfare - Reflex Edition was ported by Treyarch. The Wii version of Modern Warfare has fewer features than the other console versions. It does not support split-screen multiplayer, and the graphics are not as developed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Reflex", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107316.name: Fish Food Card Game
107316.description: A fun game for the whole family. It's a fish eat fish world out there so watch out. Get ahead by eating smaller fish and growing bigger. Use action cards in your hand to modify your size or the size of attacking sea creatures to give yourself a temporary defensive boost or to help attack an opposing player. You can even use the Swim Away card to run away from an encounter. Look out for Event cards like the Shark or Take the Bait which can mix up the game. The first player to size 10 wins, but if you get knocked down to size 0 you lose! Simple math skills are used throughout the game, although there are plenty of chances to use advanced strategy and team play too! The game instructions include several rules variations to suit the skill level of any type of player.

107317.name: PowerUp Forever
107317.description:
User Summary

This is a traditional top-down shooter. The player controls a microscopic ship that is tasked with destroying an onslaught of parasites. Once the player destroys a certain number of parasites, they must then destroy a "guardian". After destroying this creature, the player's ship grows in size and all the earlier enemies appear smaller. Features of the previous level that functioned as walls and other obstructions now reveal themselves to be new enemies that are no longer gigantic due to your growth.

This game is only available for single-player. The basic Arcade Mode unlocks other modes after beating a certain number of levels. Bonus Modes: Guardian Rush (boss mode), Survival, Defender (no offensive weapons), and Overkill (unlimited smart bombs).

107318.name: Calvin Tucker's Redneck: Farm Animal Racing Tournament
107318.description:
Calvin Tuckers Redneck: Farm Animal Racing Tournament (short: FART) is a wacky, cartoonish kart game for Nintendo Wii with loads of typical redneck humor, including a split-screen multiplayer and Wii wheel support, about eight wacky animals from a redneck farm.
Their crazy organized tournaments brings them from the Farm to the tropical Pirate island, from the Polar to Egypt, and from inside the Pyramid they are warped into time to the Medieval times and returning by a UFO back in time again. How does that sound for crazy? Every track is filled with interactive elements, everything can happen at any time.

Source: The Developer Website.

107319.name: Calvin Tucker's Redneck Jamboree
107319.description:
Every year, the people of Redneck County gather to compete in the great Redneck Jamboree! Come join them, and test your redneck skills in 12 hilarious events to gain more bottle caps then any of the four families participating to become the greatest family of the county for a year.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107320.name: Star Legion: Ignition
107320.description:
Publisher's description:

NOTE: This product requires the Star Legion game published by Deep7.

This is a supplement for the 1PG game of space opera.

So what'll you get for your buck n' some change?


Two new classes: The Engineer/Technician & The Medic
Expanded base classes: Bureaucrat, Criminal, Law Enforcement, Merchant, Mystical Order & Soldier.
Optional rules for exposures to vacuum, alien environments and radiation; designer bioweaponry, alien impregnation, bodily shock & trauma, burning, falling, drowning & suffocation, freezing and electrocution.
Guidelines for planetary survival
Other genres of SF games
Five new Star Legion scenarios

107321.name: Star Legion: Blastoff
107321.description:
Publisher's description:

NOTE: This supplement requires both the Star Legion game and The 1PG Companion from Deep7.

This is the first equipment book for the Star Legion 1PG, detailing the various military starcraft of the universe. Each entry gives a brief history of the ship classes, possible story hooks, the current roster in fleet inventory and 1PG Companion stats for the ships.

107322.name: Candace Kane's Candy Factory
107322.description:
Candy Factory is an enormously addictive puzzle-action game for the Nintendo Wii™ and Nintendo DS™ that lets players step into the fast-paced and colorful world of candy cre-ation. Players take the role of a factory-manager working for Candace or Colin Kane, two hard-working and friendly candy-makers. Join Candie and Colin on their quest to fix up the factory in order to make their way to the Candy Cup Championships.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107323.name: Puzzle Arcade
107323.description:
User Summary

This game presents the player with the ability to put together a virtual puzzle. There are a surprising number of modes in this game. Picture Puzzles is the basic mode. Within this you can choose Classic (the pieces are all spread out) or Turbo (the pieces are all arranged in orderly rows. You can also choose between Beginner, Intermediate, or Expert. The number of pieces can be altered from 12-1000. Even the puzzle pieces' shapes can be changed. Another mode is Dynamic Puzzle in which the main image shifts over time. Xbox Live Vision Camera allows you to create your own puzzle. Weekly Puzzle provides a new puzzle each week. Gamers can save the game so that they can pick up where they left off later.

Multi-player is also available with this game. This can be played with up to 4 players either co-op or competitively.

107324.name: Battleforce Bravo Adventure Pack #1
107324.description:
Publisher's description:

Note: You need Deep7's Battleforce Bravo main rules to use the product!

Have you used up all the scenarios from Battleforce Bravo yet your players are asking for more? Supplement your grunt's dangerous life with five new scenarios!

The Rat Patrol
During a mission to destroy an enemy fuel dump, the Patrol’s radio is wrecked and they are unable to warn HQ of a large Nazi anti-tank outfit waiting in ambush. The group are aware that the town of El Jebel has a huge radio broadcast unit, with the idea of capturing the radio and passing a message back to HQ.

Delayed at Dunkirk Part 1: Breakout
The characters are members of the British Expeditionary Force. They are a part of one of the units that formed the rearguard to hold back the German advance whilst the Dunkirk evacuations of 26 May to 4 June 1940 take place. It is now 5 June 1940 and the bulk of the BEF have been rescued; the characters are stranded in enemy territory and on the wrong side of the English Channel.

Delayed at Dunkirk Part 2: On the Road
Having broken out of Calais, the characters are heading towards Le Havre through occupied territory, where they understand there are still British forces that they can join up with.

A Daring Plan
Admiral Canaris, head of the Abwehr, is ordered to carry out the seemingly impossible task of capturing Prime Minister Winston Churchill and returning him to the Reich. Churchill is scheduled to visit an airfield near the village of Uphampton. The German squad of 12 men has parachuted into England, near to Uphampton, dressed as British infantrymen. They will then make preparations to ambush the convoy, capture Churchill and escape by stealing a plane from the airfield and flying it back to the Fatherland.

Radar Raiders
England throws wave after wave of bombers across the Channel, but somehow the Lufwaffe is able to shoot them down at will. News reaches the British Air Command of a secret German radar installation based on a small island off the coast of German-occupied Denmark. It seems that this must be the secret weapon that the Nazis have been employing against the British Air Force. A daring raid is required to destroy the base before Britain launches its next bomber assault against Germany.

107325.name: Captain America: Super Soldier (Wii)
107325.description:
Become Captain America, the ultimate Super Soldier, as you face Red Skull's army in this gripping original third-person action adventure set in the darkest days of World War II. Wield Captain America's legendary shield to take out enemies at a distance, interact with your environment, and deflect incoming fire back at foes as you traverse Hydra's massive castle to save the world from Cap's villainous archenemies. Get ready to hurl yourself shield-first into the fray. Create your own superhuman feats with the superior force of the world's first Super-soldier at your fingertips.

Source: The Game Website.

107326.name: R.B.I Baseball '95
107326.description:
User Summary

R.B.I. Baseball '95 is a sequel to the successful NES release of R.B.I. Baseball. R.B.I. Baseball '95 is a 32X exclusive and one of just two baseball games to be released on the platform. The game was released exclusively in the United States.

107327.name: Buzzwords
107327.description:
The party game of creative description and intuitive guessing!

Take turns giving clues to your teammates to guess certain words, but watch out! If any of your clues use one of five related words you will get buzzed! The team that successfully guesses the most words by the final round wins!

Full Version Features

Includes 1000 cards (each with 5 buzz words and 1 guess word)
Play with up to four teams
Configure Game Settings like time and rounds.
Buzz your friends using Buzz Mode%21 (requires second phone)
Customize Rules like Skipping on/off
Review and modify cards after each turn if needed
Use gestures to mark cards during a turn




The words included in Buzzwords are meant to be fun for all ages and backgrounds!

Source: The Developer Website.

107328.name: Captain Rainbow
107328.description:
The game's storyline follows, Nick, who is able to transform into "Captain★Rainbow", a yo-yo-wielding, tokusatsu-styled superhero that stars in his own TV show. Unfortunately, his TV show is no longer popular. To restore his popularity, Nick ventures to Mimin Island, an island where wishes are said to come true. Nick meets a vast array of past, minor Nintendo characters with their own dreams and wishes on his journey.

Captain★Rainbow is an action-adventure game with gameplay divided into two parts. The adventure part of the game is set on enjoying the life on the island together with its other residents. Nick can go fishing, bug catching, and help the other islanders with their requests. Most of the requests can lead to various minigames, such as boxing, volleyball, fishing and golf. Helping islanders will grant the player special, star-shaped crystals known as "Kirarin" (”Sparklies”). The action part of Captain★Rainbow is based around those crystals. Each time 20 Kirarin are collected, a star will fall from the sky. The star can be carried to an altar at the top of the island where it will grant a wish. While carrying the star to the altar Nick is challenged by a mysterious Shadow who for unknown reasons wants the star for himself. If Nick succeeds in bringing the star to the altar there will be two choices left for him. He can either grant his own wish to become a popular hero again or grant the wish of one of the islanders and go back to finding other Kirarin.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain Rainbow", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107329.name: Merv Griffin's Crosswords
107329.description:
User Summary

This game is based on a short-lived TV game-show. The object of the game is to fill in the blanks of an unknown word based on a clue. The difference from normal crosswords is that each player only gets one try to solve a word. If they get it right, they continue. If they get it wrong, it goes to the next player. Sometimes the opponent can "steal" your word and answer before you. There are over 1000 puzzles (words) available. If you don't want to play the game like the TV show, you can also play it more like a traditional crossword. This game can be played either single-player or local/network multplayer.

107330.name: Cars Race-O-Rama
107330.description:
In the game players race against new characters through action-packed tracks to win the Race-O-Rama trophy as their own personalized Lightning McQueen. Players can join Lightning McQueen in Radiator Springs as he prepares the Doc Hudson's racing academy of student racers for the Race-O-Rama competition. Lightning finds out that his rival Chick Hicks has his own set of academy student racers who don't always compete fairly (as shown during the crashing of two of Doc's students during the intro race). Lightning decided to customizes himself for the four different races: Offroad racing, street racing, beach racing, and speedway racing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cars Race-O-Rama", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107332.name: Golf Magazine: 36 Holes Starring Fred Couples
107332.description:
User Summary

Golf Magazine: 36 Great Holes Starring Fred Couples was the only golfing game released on the Sega 32X console. The game boasted of 7 game modes, digitized graphics, an improved shot control system, and battery back-up all on one 24-meg cartridge.

107333.name: FunTown Mahjong
107333.description:
User Summary

This version of Mahjong only allows for the "16-Tile/Taiwanese" rules to be applied. The gameplay is based on these traditional rules. The player can select their opponent from a group of characters, but their skills do not differ. Local play is only designed for single-player. Multi-player can accommodate up to 4 players via the network.

107334.name: Cars Toon: Mater's Tall Tales
107334.description:
Car Toon: Mater's Tall Tales is part of the Mania! line of games, featuring fast-paced, multiplayer, family fun. This captivating game is as fun to watch as it is to play and will engage up to four players of all ages. The video game will feature a large collection of pick-up-and-play games inspired by Disney Pixar's popular Mater's Tall Tales animated short series. The game will bring Mater together with Lightning McQueen and the "Cars" gang for a new set of adventures, capturing the endearing sense of humor of everyone's favorite tow truck. Players will join Mater and his pals as they relive the wild stories he conjures up about hilariously unpredictable events that may or may not have taken place.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107335.name: Quest DVD Video Show
107335.description: A trivia game that involves a board, cards and DVD, and bring questions about soap operas and other programs of TV Globo, a Brazilian television network. More than 2,000 questions that will test your knowledge, reliving moments from the TV, with videos and pictures on a DVD.

107336.name: Minesweeper Flags
107336.description:
User Summary

This game uses the same game mechanics that everyone remembers from the early 90s. The Classic Mode plays just like it always has, except is is now presented in a 3D 3/4 top-down view. Each level has a theme based on a different continent. The other major difference from the traditional Minesweeper, is that this game has different shapes to the grid pattern. The outline is not always going to be square.

The multi-player game is a little unusual. All the players are working at the same time to try and mark as many mines as they can before their opponents do. This is available either locally or on the network.

107338.name: Zombie Wranglers
107338.description:
User Summary

This game is all about how kids are the only ones who can save the day, and wrangle the zombies that have invaded their town. It is presented in a third-person view. There are four characters from which to choose (all can be used in co-op), and each has their own style of "weapons". Cash is earned when you turn in your catches. This cash can be used to buy powerups during the game. There are 20 missions and most require the player to capture a certain number of zombies. Some levels also unleash a boss that must be defeated. The overall feel of the game is that it is designed to appeal to younger gamers.

The multi-player can either be co-op or competitive and is able to be played locally or via the network.

107339.name: His and Hers
107339.description:
From Publishers Website:

Men are endlessly mystified about the contents of a woman's handbag, their wardrobe and what they read in their magazines... equally, women don't understand a man's need for gadgets, power tools and their obsession with sport.

The His and Hers board game is a celebration of our differences as seen through everyday THINGS. Divide your friends into single sex teams, and have some FUN celebrating what makes women women and men men.

His and Hers is definitely not a "rude and crude" game, but please note that a few of the questions do have adult content.

Basic Gameplay Synopsis:
The two teams split by gender, each take turns asking questions from the cards, which have different types of questions and categories of a generally trivia style. (each team has a designated "Question Master") Each question also has a color code associated with it. Should the question asked be answered correctly, the answering team's playing piece is moved on the board to the next space that corresponds to that particular question color code. Should they answer incorrectly, the opposing team gets a chance to steal the question and possible board movement.

Contents:
- Playing Board
- 400 Question Cards (200 Pink and 200 Blue)
- 2 Playing pieces (Pink and Blue)

107340.name: Blazing Birds
107340.description:
User Summary

This was one of the winners of Microsoft's 2007 Dream-Build-Play contest. It is based on the traditional game of badminton, but uses robots instead of the normal players. The game is presented as a one-on-one in a 2D plane with a side-on view. The major difference between this and normal badminton, is that this game also uses "power shots". These unleash a variety of powers during the hit.

Single player has two modes: Arcade Mode (a 20-match series against AI players) or Elimination Mode (competing in a tournament against 4, 8 or 16 AI players where one loss end the tournament). Multi-player modes involve: Exhibition (1, 3, 5 or 11 rounds), a Round Robin tourney (from 3 to 20 players); or an Elimination Mode battle (4, 8 or 16 players). Multi-player is only available locally. There is no network support.

107341.name: Moe Mekuri 2
107341.description:
User Summary

In this game you must arrange a group of panels to form a path. A pinball will travel along the path and flip the tiles to reveal a beautiful girl shouting at you. Wacky music accompanies your journey.

107342.name: Ninja Sneaking
107342.description:
User Summary

In this side-scrolling platformer, you play a tiny ninja who must sneak through houses and gardens avoiding all enemies. The game is over if you are caught. If you are caught, you must start at the beginning of the level.

107343.name: Beach Bubbles Chapter 2: Shawli's Fantasy
107343.description:
User Summary

In this simple puzzle game, you must collect all the bubbles in a maze without getting hit. Your sprite floats around with a jetpack and you must avoid floating robots in order to collect everything. Finishing a level reveals a portion of a pretty lady in the background. You must avoid environmental obstacles such as rising water.

107344.name: Skits
107344.description: Card Game. Each card represents one of the counties of England. In a turn, you play cards that relate to the county in play, or to a county adjacent to it on a map. The first card played will always be either Northumberland or Cornwall. If the former, play will proceed down the country, so-to-speak. If it is the latter play will proceed up the country.The first player to use all their cards, wins.

107345.name: Cute Things Dying Violently
107345.description:
User Summary

In this game, you must help cute critters escape untimely deaths by aiming and shooting them towards their escape. The controls function like slingshots, flinging the ball-shaped critters across the screen. Saws, spikes, and explosions threaten the tiny adorable creatures. Rescue them all for a high score!

107346.name: Globe Clicker
107346.description:
User Summary

In this game you must beat the clock by locating areas on a massive globe. A location is given and you must pinpoint it. You earn more points the closer you get to the location. There are different modes, such as US Cities and Nighttime view.

107347.name: Nova Remnant
107347.description:
User Summary

The aim of this game is to clear the screen of asteroids. This is done by hovering your cursor over them and blowing them up. You may then destroy and collect the aliens living inside the asteroids to make your score higher.
